intro: Knautia sylvatica var. transalpina, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for alpine gardens. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its prolonged blooming period, typically from late spring to early summer.
